column4: hey guys.. im trying to compile alsa utils from source, when doing make install i get a line: /bin/bash: m: command not found, what is this command??
the error comes up in the middle of install
sounds like a bug in whatever script you're running. ive never heard of an "m" command

alsa and oss are both possible sound drivers / low-leel libraries. alsa has the upstream kernel's blessing, oss does not. they each support a wide range of hardware, but it is not an identical subset, so it's possible switching from one to the other can clear up an issue
which ALC259 do you have? "lspci -vv | grep -A1 0403"
that doesnt return anything
ok how about:  grep Subsystem /proc/asound/card*/codec*
hang on....given that new versions of alsa are packaged and in the repositories, why were you trying to compile it at all?
was following the snd-hda-intel guide for ubuntu
link please? i want to see who's recommending doing that when linux-backports-modules-alsa-maverick-generic exists
(and -karmic- and -lucid- )
ALC259 is in no way specific
but things are fixed on individual hardware basis
thats why i asked for the Subsystem Id listed in the codec dump
your command didnt work, said the directory does not exist
no /proc/asound? oooh well then... thats an interesting level of failure there
well, unless you already removed alsa, in which case it makes sense
but alright, have fun with oss. if it doesnt work out, switch back to alsa before asking help in here as oss isnt supported in ubuntu
alright, thanks
you said earlier that the latest Alsa stuff is in the repos?
are you still there?
